programme.desc: Coverage of today's meetings at the Curragh, Chepstow and Stratford.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017
programme.desc: David Dimbleby takes the helm for the BBC's comprehensive overnight coverage as the results of the snap General Election are announced. Over the next 24 hours the people of Britain will discover who will lead them over the next five years. BBC correspondents led by Andrew Marr, Nick Robinson, Kirsty Wark and Sophie Raworth will be at the key counts, while Jeremy Vine, Emily Maitlis and Professor John Curtice analyse the results as they come in. Mishal Husain interviews key political players, media editor Amol Rajan follows how the night is unfolding on social media and political editor Laura Kuenssberg assesses the impact this result will have in the days, weeks and years ahead.(n)

programme.title: Election Results 2017
programme.desc: Glenn Campbell presents live coverage of declarations and reports from every count across Scotland and the key moments throughout the UK.(n)

programme.title: Election Results 2017
programme.desc: Election results from across the region.(n)

programme.title: Election Results 2017
programme.desc: Huw Edwards presents, with Emily Maitlis and Jeremy Vine analysing the overnight results and explaining how votes have translated into a new political order. Plus, Andrew Marr provides political analysis and Jo Coburn monitors the latest reaction to the result as expressed on social media. Including news and weather on the hour, regional news at 7.30 and 8.30.(n)

programme.title: Election Results 2017
programme.desc: Huw Edwards presents, with Andrew Neil reporting from the House of Commons as politicians return to Westminster and BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg monitoring events in Downing Street. Emily Maitlis and Jeremy Vine analyse the later results and explain how votes have translated into a new political order. Plus, Andrew Marr provides political analysis and Jo Coburn monitors the latest reaction to the outcome as expressed on social media. Continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha gets a shock visitor, while Emma and Zara try to be helpful but make things worse. Elsewhere, Ruhma and Heston wonder if they are a making a big song-and-dance over nothing.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which players compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton welcomes returning expats back the UK as he helps them find a home in rural Gloucestershire on a budget of £700,000. Plus, the presenter visits Slimbridge Wetland Centre in time for the spring-time hatching of a rare breed of duckling.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Galton Blackiston, Frances Atkins, Rupert Rowley and Theo Randall pair up with their chosen home cook partners and go head to head in the ultimate pro-am cooking competition.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Kate Bliss v John Cameron Showdown.
programme.desc: Kate Bliss takes on John Cameron in the final challenge - the showdown. They must each make purchases at all of their four regular buying locations and sell at least half at auction. One expert will be crowned champion once all the deals are done. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan, the BBC's media editor, host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Wales rugby union star Scott Quinnell, ex-Everton midfielder Leon Osman, former British number one tennis player Annabel Croft and Ryder Cup-winning golfer Nicolas Colsaerts join regular team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Martin excitedly attend their baby scan, although when Stacey later admits to her husband she is worried how people will react to her being pregnant again, Martin agrees to keep the news quiet. Abi does her best to support Lauren - but things soon become tricky - Jane and Kathy clash over Ian's new lifestyle, and Louise does her best to avoid Travis.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: In the immediate wake of the General Election, David Dimbleby chairs a special edition of the topical debate from London as guests from the worlds of politics and the media answer questions posed by members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got Election News for You.
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand assumes the mantle as host, inviting former Labour MP Alan Johnson and comedian Ross Noble to join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton on the satirical current affairs quiz.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham chats to WBA, IBF and IBO heavyweight boxing champion Anthony Joshua, who recently secured his status thanks to his 11th round knockdown of Ukrainian opponent Wladimir Klitschko. Oscar-winning actress Rachel Weisz discusses her new film My Cousin Rachel, while Shawn Mendes performs There's Nothing Holdin' Me Back, and actor Martin Freeman and comedian Greg Davies are also on the sofa.(n)

programme.title: The Proposal
programme.desc: A Canadian publishing editor working in New York faces deportation to her own country. Desperate to stay in America, she offers her assistant a promotion if he will marry her, but an immigration official becomes suspicious and the pair are forced to go to desperate lengths to look like a happy couple. Romantic comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: BBC radio presenter Fearne Cotton joins Michel Roux Jr, as chefs Sabrina Ghayour and Lawrence Keogh prepare dishes for her to sample in the studio kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge is in her own kitchen to give step-by-step instructions for recipes for everyday meals and special occasions. She begins with advice on how to host a traditional tea party, sharing a clever trick for making sandwiches in advance and baking bite-sized scones for a cream tea, while her grand-daughters help her make orange butterfly cakes. Mary also visits a plantation in Cornwall to find out how tea is grown.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of nurses takes on a duo of paramedics in Derby, with the assistance of antiques experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott finds an archaic system of communication at the fair, before visiting the V&A Museum of Childhood in London.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Golden Gala Pietro Mennea. Gabby Logan presents action from the fourth Diamond League event of the season, which was held at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple looking to buy their first home together in rural Staffordshire on a budget of £700,000, and also learns about the county's influence on agriculture and architecture.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths hidden gems at a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, including a rusty petrol can and an old chest of drawers.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the quiz featuring famous names from the world of TV wildlife programmes. Taking part are Chris Packham and Martin Hughes-Games, Tom Heap and Jules Hudson, Miranda Krestovnikoff and Paul Heiney, and Naomi Wilkinson and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord, Bill and Nardole find themselves on Mars, but despite removing themselves from Earth, they still end up embroiled in yet another stand-off between humanity and alien forces. This time, though, mankind has become the aggressor. In a bid to extend their queen's empire into space, Victorian soldiers have somehow invaded the red planet, and their activities threaten to awaken a hive of militant Ice Warriors, for whom Mars is home. As tensions escalate, the Doctor faces a unique dilemma. He has vowed to serve humanity as its protector, but when it is the humans who are the invaders, whose side should he take? Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with pair each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Violence at a right-wing rally outside a local Muslim community centre brings plenty of patients in to Holby's ER, including Mickey, who Jez is dismayed to learn has still been supporting his racist family. Ethan discovers Scott Ellisson has been released from police custody without charge, and when he turns up at the hospital alongside his injured brother, Ethan spots a chance to confront him about Cal's death. Meanwhile, Iain worries Lily is overdoing it as she prepares for her consultancy exams, and Duffy tries to help Charlie process his grief, as he ignores his own emotions in an attempt to help his colleagues deal with Cal's untimely demise.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs divulge what sound like tall tales about themselves, before their rival contestants decide whether they are lying. Greg Davies takes Lee Mack's place as guest captain, and joining him and David Mitchell are choir leader Gareth Malone, Sherlock actress Amanda Abbington, comedian and Buzzcocks panellist Phill Jupitus and Pointless co-host Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: A 19th-century imperial guard to the Emperor of China faces a clash of cultures when he is flung into the Wild West on a mission to rescue a princess who has been kidnapped by a renegade. In a bid to complete his quest, he teams up with a bumbling outlaw. Comedy Western, starring Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Jason Connery and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British nurse races to rescue a critically ill baby in a remote town in the Bush, while a group of UK cops deal with trouble at a funeral in the Outback.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team unravels some of the costs involved in eating out, and ask whether restaurants charge a fair price for wine. Plus, the ins and outs of tipping.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Theo Randall puts three amateur cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make linguine asparagus carbonara, choosing one of them to join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Mark Lane is in Hackney, finding out how a car wrecker's yard at the side of a Tudor National Trust property has been transformed into an award-winning garden used by the local community. Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their euphorbia collection and Rachel de Thame visits a garden which has opened to the public every year for 90 years as part of the National Gardens Scheme.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman enters Barnsley Hospital's A&E Department short of breath. At Leeds Children's Hospital, a five-year-old ends his leukaemia treatment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Crewe in Cheshire, Chartham Hatch, Kent and Rusholme, Manchester to hear their renovation plans.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford explore the implications of the recent vegetable shortage, and the effect it continues to have today. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A pit stop in a motorcycle race is engulfed in flames when fuel spills out of a rider's tank, and a holiday maker on safari gets too close to a family of cheetahs. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Kingston upon Thames, south west London, two teams of mothers and sons are challenged to pick up bargains at an antiques fair. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss are on hand to guide them towards turning a profit at auction as presenter Tim Wonnacott observes proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Property series in which people get the chance to experience life in Australia or New Zealand before deciding whether they want to make the move permanently.(n)

programme.title: Election Results 2017
programme.desc: Coverage transfers from BBC One with Andrew Neil reporting from the House of Commons as politicians return to Westminster and BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg monitoring events in Downing Street. Presented by Huw Edwards, with analysis by Andrew Marr, Emily Maitlis, Jeremy Vine and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Chris Packham is joined by Floella Benjamin, while Ballerina-turned-Strictly star Darcey Bussell shares her wild side in Hide Share and Lindsey Chapman sets the Unsprung Quiz.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Genoa to the Brenner Pass - Part One.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers how an Edwardian Briton brought football to the Italian port of Genoa. He also finds himself ambushed by singers of the city's legendary trallalero and learns to whip up a mean pesto Genovese. After sampling la dolce vita in Portofino, Michael takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the impossibly picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a national park. A fishing trip in the bay affords spectacular views of the villages from the water.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Wales chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Dan Bloxham - Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies responsible for presenting the trophy to the tournament's champions - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Resolutions are tested as Louis XIV returns to Versailles vowing to purify his private life, while Madame de Montespan hopes to cement her place in his heart. The feelings of Philippe for Chevalier are rocked by an unexpected depth of concern for Princess Palatine, who shows symptoms of possible poisoning. Meanwhile, Fabien Marchal faces a personal appeal to review his refusal to return. George Blagden, Anna Brewster, Alexander Vlahos, Evan Williams, Jessica Clark and Tygh Runyan star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Award-winning funnywoman Gina Yashere introduces surreal Australian comedian Sam Simmons and rising comedy star Ellie Taylor to the stage in a gig recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur as the outcome of the General Election becomes apparent. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Evan Davis, Kirsty Wark and Emily Maitlis report on the outcome of the General Election.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: New Zealand v Bangladesh. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group A teams face each other at The SSE SWALEC in Cardiff.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Back to the Falklands: Brothers in Arms - Panorama.
programme.desc: The programme explores how the trauma of fighting a war can continue to affect soldiers even decades later, following men who served in the Welsh Guards as they return to the Falkland Islands for the first time since the conflict in 1982 to confront their demons.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part one of two. Return of the documentary about the construction of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London, following those racing to complete the work in time for the first trains to run in May. Engineer Linda Miller and her team must battle ancient fault lines that threaten the Farringdon station site with flooding, while construction workers build innovative floating rail tracks directly under the Barbican Concert Hall. Julian Barratt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The whole world has fallen under the sway of a mass delusion, and it seems only Bill Potts can see through it. Even the Doctor is unable to comprehend the truth, meaning it is up to Bill to set the record straight by persuading her friend that humanity is in deadly danger. But a Time Lord's conviction is not easily broken, and with the fate of an entire species on the line, if Bill cannot get the Doctor on-side, she may find herself forced to kill him. Sci-fi drama, with Pearl Mackie, Peter Capaldi and Matt Lucas and guest star Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter P, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Dance, Girl, Dance
programme.desc: An aspiring dancer goes to New York hoping to become a ballerina, but the only work she can get is as a sidekick to a burlesque performer. Their already awkward working relationship falls apart completely when both women fall in love with a wealthy playboy. Musical comedy, with Maureen O'Hara, Lucille Ball and Louis Hayward.(n)

programme.title: The Westerner
programme.desc: A wandering cowboy gets mixed up in a range war between cattlemen and homesteaders in 1880s Texas, antagonising the notorious Judge Roy Bean in the process. He manages to escape the death sentence thanks to a quick-witted con - but is forced to take drastic action to bring the lawman's tyranny to an end. Western, starring Gary Cooper and an Oscar-winning Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Mark Horton explores the history of the Holy Island of Lindisfarne. He relives the first Viking raid in June 793AD and discovers how the marauding Norsemen galvanised the warring Anglo-Saxon kingdoms to form the English nation.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Hebridean Escape
programme.desc: The marine biologist tries to raise funds to publish his research on walking trails and enlists the help of artist Steve Burgess. As Christmas approaches, he takes ceilidh lessons and indulges in a bit of wildlife watching, before celebrating the festive season with a dip in the sea and dinner with friends, and learning that the local ranger committee has decided to take on board his recommendations to employ a permanent ranger. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander meets a World Cup rugby player developing a house in Streatham, London, and Martin Roberts looks round a house in Newport, Shropshire and meets a young developer who has bought a terraced house in Cwmfelinfach, Wales - the ninth property he has worked on so far.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales prepare starters, with returning chef Phil Carmichael taking on newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie. The three chefs all create complex dishes, with both Paul and Phil championing the tomato, while Nick hopes his rabbit and carrot dish will give him the edge over the other two.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops. Meanwhile, Phil Carmichael and Nick Brodie are both preparing meals using mackerel which hope they can elevate for the exacting standards of the All England Club.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales, returning chef Phil Carmichael and newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie, go all out to impress with their main courses. Each chef uses Welsh lamb as the centrepiece of their dish, showcasing a range of techniques and using an array of unusual ingredients to elevate their main courses to banquet level.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profiles of stars of the silver screen, beginning with actress Bette Davis, whose Hollywood career took off with the fledgling film production company Warner Brothers in 1932. The programme includes her television appearances made over the years, and captures the milestones and highlights of her fame, including her role in horror movie What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? in which she co-starred with Joan Crawford as a former child star caring for her disabled sister. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts James Braxton and Helen Hall conclude their road trip, beginning in Hampstead, north-west London, before stopping off in Brighton, East Sussex, en route to an auction in Lewes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Genoa to the Brenner Pass - Part Two.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through Italy, from the Riviera to the Alps. This time, he takes in the OTS Virginio Fasan at La Spezia, an important Italian naval base. He also visits Parma to sample the city's signature cheese and ham, and takes a trip to the Teatro Regio opera, where a local company is rehearsing music by Verdi. Taking the fast train across the Po Valley, Michael heads toward the Alps, and hitches a ride in a modern Rolls Royce Dawn as he discovers how the car manufacturer secured its reputation on the winding roads of Rovereto in 1913.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring enlists an unusual recruit to the platoon - a tracker dog provided by Walker. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring John Le Mesurier, Arthur Lowe and Clive Dunn.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Academy Summer Exhibition
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark and Brenda Emmanus tour the Royal Academy galleries during a glamorous private preview of this year's Summer Exhibition, which is due to open to the public on Tuesday. The exhibition sees established British artists displaying work alongside that of less well-known contemporaries, and here, Kirsty and Brenda go behind the scenes of the event in the run-up to the grand opening. The pair meet some of the featured artists, and explore the process of curating the world's largest open-submission exhibition.(n)

programme.title: Live International Rugby Union
programme.desc: Argentina v England (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the opening match of the two-Test series, staged at the Estadio San Juan del Bicentenario in San Juan. This tour represents a chance for several players to stake a claim to a regular place in Eddie Jones' squad, with England missing their leading stars to the Lions' tour of New Zealand. With commentary by Eddie Butler and Andy Robinson, and analysis by Clive Woodward and Jeremy Guscott.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the Group A clash in the final round of pool-stage fixtures, which took place at Edgbaston.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Resolutions are tested as Louis XIV returns to Versailles vowing to purify his private life, while Madame de Montespan hopes to cement her place in his heart. The feelings of Philippe for Chevalier are rocked by an unexpected depth of concern for Princess Palatine, who shows symptoms of possible poisoning. Meanwhile, Fabien Marchal faces a personal appeal to review his refusal to return. George Blagden, Anna Brewster, Alexander Vlahos, Evan Williams, Jessica Clark and Tygh Runyan star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright introduce performances by the Icicle Works, Howard Jones, Shakin' Stevens and Bonnie Tyler, Roland Rat, Snowy White, Lionel Richie, Joe Fagin and Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: Leonard Sachs chairs the old-time music hall programme, inviting Bernard Cribbins, Barry Cryer, Robert Tear, Benjamin Luxon, Penny Lane, Larry Parker, Teddy Peiro & Patricio, and members of the Players' Theatre, London to entertain an audience at the Leeds City Varieties. First aired February 22, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Classic tracks from the decade, featuring the Who's anthem Won't Get Fooled Again and the Rolling Stones' Brown Sugar.(n)

programme.title: The Summer of Love: How Hippies Changed the World
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary recounting the 1967 coming-together that would change the world. The film traces the roots of the hippies to a 19th-century German sect of wandering naturalists that brought its freethinking ideas to California after the Second World War. There it merged with people expressing an interest in Eastern mystical concepts of human nature expounded by thinkers like Aleister Crowley and Aldous Huxley. Added to the mix was the CIA-developed drug LSD and a wave of student activists and anti-war protestors. The outcome was San Francisco's Summer of Love.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Elton John, Willie Nelson, Merle Haggard, Alabama Shakes, Jack White, Nas, Ana Gabriel, Beck, Los Lobos and Steve Martin are among the modern artists who test their skills against the demands of the recording machine that literally made American music. There are no edits, no overdubs, and no retakes, and the disc only allows for three minutes of recording time. Despite these limitations, today's recordings for American Epic have one advantage - the freshly recorded sound is crystal clear and of an astonishing depth, transporting listeners vividly into the past - and the future. Narrated by Robert Redford. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright introduce performances by the Icicle Works, Howard Jones, Shakin' Stevens and Bonnie Tyler, Roland Rat, Snowy White, Lionel Richie, Joe Fagin and Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: The Summer of Love: How Hippies Changed the World
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary recounting the 1967 coming-together that would change the world. The film traces the roots of the hippies to a 19th-century German sect of wandering naturalists that brought its freethinking ideas to California after the Second World War. There it merged with people expressing an interest in Eastern mystical concepts of human nature expounded by thinkers like Aleister Crowley and Aldous Huxley. Added to the mix was the CIA-developed drug LSD and a wave of student activists and anti-war protestors. The outcome was San Francisco's Summer of Love.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough chooses the 10 endangered animals from around the world that he would most like to save from extinction, explaining why these creatures are so important and highlighting the work of biologists helping to keep them alive. His list includes Darwin's frog, the Sumatran rhino, Priam's birdwing butterfly and the black lion tamarin.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes the annual surge of more than 100 million sardines along South Africa's east coast as inshore waters cool with the arrival of winter. programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed And Fabulous, the highly anticipated sequel to the surprise smash hit Miss Congeniality, homes in on FBI agent Gracie Hart shortly after she successfully disarmed a threat against the Miss United States Pageant while working undercover as a contestant. Having become a media celebrity as a result of her pageant heroics, Gracie now spends more time at the salon than the shooting range, as she works the talk show circuit to promote her book. When her pageant friends, winner Cheryl and emcee Stan, are kidnapped in Las Vegas, Gracie jumps back into action to save them, putting herself at loggerheads with the FBI top brass, who don't want to risk losing their prized mascot and who fear she might not be up to the job anymore(n)

programme.desc: Algie and the Princess have a sleepover at the castle, but the girl becomes too excited to go to bed when she discovers it might be inhabited by dragons.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Snow ruins Peppa's trip to the beach with her friends and family.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig gives Grandma and Grandpa her old computer - but they have trouble working out how to use it.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her friends go with Madame Gazelle to see Pedro Pony, who is unwell.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly accidentally turns Ben into a frog, and on attempting to rectify her error makes matters even worse.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team must overcome impossible odds to acquire the final Black Hole Generator piece.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles appraises the best gadgets for this summer's music festivals, with highlights including a new type of tepee that accommodates nine people and takes just three minutes to erect, a camping stove that generates electricity while cooking dinner, a camera that combines the retro style of instant prints with modern photo editing, and a Mini Countryman car with a brand new type of roof-mounted tent. Plus, Georgie Barrat meets sailor Ben Ainslie in Bermuda, where he is planning to triumph in the America's Cup boat race having created one of the most technologically advanced boats ever. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jimmy and his dog Boas find a dangerous weapon, while Kev and Pete are involved in a high-speed pursuit. An armed response team is called out to deal with a drunken man brandishing a gun, while Andy is confronted with am aggressive drink driver refusing to take a breath test.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Paul Jackson has his work cut out stopping a runaway van driver who is causing havoc, while a street disturbance leads Paul Faulkner and Lee Wilson to stare down the barrels of a shotgun. Plus, Kev Salter and the team raid a cannabis farm and make a shocking discovery.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ian Stapley pursues a trail of sparks left by a car thief with a burst front tyre, while Jacko heads up the firearms team as they look for two men seen in possession of a sawn-off shotgun. Shadow the police dog nearly takes a bite of a barricaded burglar and Kev Salter deals with a heroin user who hides her stash in a hard-to-reach place.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The first Berlin ePrix race. Coverage of the first of two races staged at the Tempelhof Airport Street Circuit in Berlin, which serves as the seventh round of the season.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kent couple Rachel and Chris are pushed to the limit when their relationship with their tenant breaks down and she stops paying rent, leaving them more than £5,000 out of pocket. Now they need to get her out or they could lose the house. Elsewhere, a tenant uses scare tactics to keep his landlord off his back, and in Harrow, council housing officers investigate a residential property that has been turned into a brothel.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A man whose amateur radio hobby caused upset in his quiet retirement village when he erected a 30ft mast, kicking up a storm of protest from his neighbours who claimed it was affecting their health. Plus, a woman who was forced to take out an injunction against her neighbour over his aggressive behaviour, and a couple who moved back to their home town with their four children and menagerie of pets - only to hear rumours being passed around, shortly followed by a visit from the council about the state of their home.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Pensioner and single dad George chose a Grimsby cul-de-sac for a bit of peace and quiet, only for a raucous twentysomething to move in next door and start throwing loud parties. But when George complained, violence erupted - and blood was spilled. In Croydon, old friends became enemies when one couple's car began to block access to the other's home, while Stoke musicians Anne and Dave were puzzled when their neighbour complained about the noise they were making, since they were 200 miles away performing at the time.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben try to drill through the locks on a property to evict the residents, only to find to their surprise that the door has been modified with some special reinforced metal. Elsewhere, Delroy and Brian try to reclaim money a garage owes to a customer and are shocked by the condition of the vehicle in question, and a woman who has acted as guarantor for her sister's tenancy does not realise the extent of her responsibilities.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Staffordshire agents try to collect nearly £2,500 in unpaid parking fines, while officers Matt and Gary head to the West Midlands to recover £4,500 owed from a debtor to his former girlfriend. Elsewhere, agents travel to south east London looking to collect £3,000 owed by a taxi company.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing the housemates' reactions to the first eviction, as well as the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs and diary room visits. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Bad TV
programme.desc: A look back at the decade that brought many opportunities for eye-popping errors, but few more ill-conceived than sitcom Heil Honey I'm Home!, which featured fictionalised versions of Adolf Hitler and Eva Braun living next door to a Jewish couple. The intention was to spoof 1950s American sitcoms, but most critics felt the show fell short on taste and decency.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle UK
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle UK: Peter Andre vs Gino D'Acampo.
programme.desc: Melanie Brown and Professor Green present the musical game show as reality star Peter Andre and presenter and Italian TV chef Gino D'Acampo go head to head lip-synching to hit songs. Their first choice of song is anticipated to be relatively sober, but for their second the celebs must bring it all to the floor - with wigs, costumes and backing dancers.(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: Marie is an American born in Russia who was abandoned as an infant, returns to Russia a few decades later to visit the family estate along with her brother who was also abandoned, but raised in Russia. Together they explore the old homestead in the hopes of rediscovering their pasts and unearthing the truth about the family they never knew(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: San Francisco Police Inspector 'Dirty' Harry Callahan and his new partner, Early Smith have been temporarily reassigned from Homicide to Stakeout Duty. Meanwhile, those of the city's criminals who manage to avoid punishment by the courts are nevertheless being killed by unknown assassins. Callahan begins to investigate the murders despite the orders of his superior officer, Lieutenant Briggs. A man has to know his limitations..(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: Prot (Kevin Spacey) is a mysterious patient at a mental hospital who claims to be from a far away planet called K-Pax and that Earth is too bright for his eyes. He is handed over by psychiatrist Mark Powell (Jeff Bridges) who notices that the man sounds very convincing. This new finding makes Dr. Powell wonder about his own abilities to distinguish reality from fantasy. The plot of K-Pas shares many contact points with Man Facing Southeast by Eliseo Subiela(n)

programme.title: Cry-Baby
programme.desc: In 1950s Baltimore, an uppity rich girl and a tough from the other side of the tracks fall in love(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller. Returning from a routine mission to repair a satellite, astronaut Spencer Armacost briefly loses radio contact with mission control. Spencer lands safely back on Earth, but as time passes his wife's anxiety grows - her husband seems somehow different since his return. And what are the implications for the twins she is now carrying?(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Bikini: Una historia real
programme.desc: In 1950s Spain, a small-town mayor wants to convince everyone to allow women to wear bikinis on the beach(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: An exemplary biopic that focuses on the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece "In Cold Blood"(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. The success of that product leads to a home-shopping empire and her ascension to matriarch of her family(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between rookie cop Ben Barber (Kevin Hart) and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) James Payton (Ice Cube) in this sequel to the hit action comedy Ride Along. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a local drug lord with the help of a savvy detective (Olivia Munn). Directed by Tim Story(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Newlywed Ted wants to become a father, but must prove he's a person in a court of law first(n)

programme.title: Auto Focus
programme.desc: Biopic examining the sordid secret life of Bob Crane, popular star of the 1960s sitcom "Hogan's Heroes". Based on the book "The Murder of Bob Crane", by Robert Graysmith(n)

programme.title: Olvidados
programme.desc: General Jose Mendieta (Damien Alcazar) writes a letter to his son Pablo (Bernardo Pena) after suffering a heart attack and confesses the role he played in torturing and executing men and women as part of Operation Condor in Chile in this drama. The CIA backed campaign of political repression was responsible for imprisoning and executing countless men and women in Latin America in the 1970s. Journalist Marco (Carlotto Cotta) and his wife pregnant wife Lucia (Carla Ortiz) were among many people who suffered under Mendieta and his cohort Sanera (Rafael Ferro Guapas). Olvidados was Bolivia's Foreign Language Film Submission for the 87th Academy Awards. The film is directed by Carlos Bolado(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin scores as a hip secret agent in this hilarious spoof of blaxploitation flicks, directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Griffin's character works for a black spy organization that's battling "The Man" and his efforts to suppress black culture. Denise Richards costars as White She-Devil. Chris Kattan, Dave Chappelle(n)

programme.title: Chasing Papi
programme.desc: Smooth-talking Tomas has a gorgeous girlfriend in Chicago... and one in New York, and one in Miami. But life gets really hot when his Latino trio find out about one another(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: After purchasing a brownstone in New York, a thirty-something divorced woman and her daughter are forced to take advantage of the hidden room the 'panic room' when intruders break into their home. However, they soon find that what the intruders want is locked in the panic room with them(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Screenwriter Randall Wallace, a specialist in sweeping historical epics, steps behind the camera for this fact-based Vietnam War drama that reunites him with his Braveheart (1995) star Mel Gibson. Gibson is Lt. Col. Hal Moore, commander of the First Battalion, Seventh Cavalry, the same regiment fatefully led by George Armstrong Custer. As part of the Pleiku Campaign of late 1965, Moore is assigned to an action at Landing Zone X-Ray in the Drang Valley, an area that would come to be known as the "The Valley of Death." Moore soon finds himself and his men contained to an area about the size of a football field, surrounded by more than 2,000 enemy troops and engaged in the first major battle of the war. Heroism becomes the order of the day as men like Moore, chopper pilot Bruce Crandall (Greg Kinnear), and Lt. Henry Herrick (Marc Blucas) refuse to yield, in spite of heavy losses of life. The film co-stars Madeleine Stowe, Chris Klein, Keri Russell, and Sam Elliott. We Were Soldiers is based on the book We Were Soldiers Once...and Young by Lt. Gen. Harold G. Moore (retired) and UPI reporter Joe Galloway (played in the film by Barry Pepper)(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A gripping drama based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Doses of radiation turn a mild-mannered scientist into an angry, uncontrollable monstrosity in this adaptation of the Marvel Comics series. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars and directs in this, his twelfth film behind the camera but the first with a military setting. He plays a tough Marine drill sergeant at odds with the new generation of officers who charge him with whipping a platoon of misfits into shape. The irony is they're from his old battle unit but soon, his rigidity inspires them and, come the invasion of Grenada, they are a crack fighting unit(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: This compelling drama details the unlikely friendship that develops between a bigoted Korean War veteran and an Asian teen who, under threat from some gangbangers, tries to steal his car: a cherry 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2

programme.desc: Hell on Earth 2006. Satan decides to have a Sweet 16 style party in L.A. on Halloween. The gang perform a ritual and mange to summon Biggie Smalls - who demands Butters helps him get to the party!(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: D-Yikes. Ms Garrison gets dumped again, so the boys decide to hire someone to remedy the situation(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Bebe's Boobs Destroy Society. Bebe has started to develop breasts, and the boys have noticed(n)

programme.desc: Landlord. The first-season finale features a babysitter dealing with a young Forest Whitaker; an apartment rented by a suspicious landlord; President Obama's desire to be treated like an ordinary citizen; and partygoers trying to liven up a bar mitzvah(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: The Branding. Sketches include the black-university experience; celebrity entourages; a neighbourhood's reaction to a mythical creature; controversial words; and President Obama's anger translator(n)

programme.desc: Shark is known for its incredible carpet cleaning. Now, with the addition of a soft brushroll, you can do even more, such as cleaning stuck-on, small & large particles. Also offers anti-allergen complete seal technology & advanced swivel steering(n)

programme.title: PiYo Craze!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Accidents Caught on Camera with HD Mirror Cam!
programme.desc: See crazy accidents caught on camera with the HD Mirror Cam - the most important tool you'll ever own for your car! HD Mirror Cam turns any rearview mirror into a dash cam, and captures it all so if anything ever happens you always have the proof!(n)

programme.title: Show More Skin & Love the Way You Look
programme.desc: What is crepey skin? It's skin that has lost firmness, elasticity and moisture with age. Now, Jane Seymour and Dr. Ordon show you how you can visibly treat and repair the look of crepey skin. www.CrepeErase.com(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City star Kristin Davis on Her Gorgeous Hair Care Secrets!
programme.desc: In this beauty segment, featuring Kristin Davis and Kate Middleton's hairdresser, Richard Ward, discover how a breakthrough hair volumizing system called VOLAIRE™ is giving women everywhere, thicker, fuller-looking, mega-sexy hair instantly!(n)

programme.desc: Cindy Crawford's Beauty Secrets! Cindy's Targeted Beauty Trio is new for 2017! Rediscover your skin's youthful radiance. This new offer is free to you as part of Meaningful Beauty ULTRA! That's 3 free gifts and free shipping today!(n)

programme.title: Try Total Gym for $14.95
programme.desc: Total Gym Fit is the only piece of fitness equipment you need to get into the best shape of your life! 30 Day Risk-Free Trial for only $14.95. Call today!(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Career Day. Eric makes a new friend after sharing interest in his new friends car. Kelso and Hyde are upset when Eric spends more time with the new guy than them(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Prom Night. Eric's (Topher Grace) plans for a hotel-room rendezvous on prom night are spoiled by his friends. Having been dumped by Jackie (Mila Kunis), Kelso (Ashton Kutcher) feels perfectly justified in finding another prom date -- whereupon the dateless Jackie turns to Hyde (Danny Masterson) for sympathy (and a corsage). During the dance, Fez (Wilmer Valderrama) finds himself attracted to an older woman -- a teacher, to be precise. And Midge (Tanya Roberts) drives another wedge in her marriage when she dreams of starting her own business. Veteran cartoon voice-over actress Grey Delisle is seen as Ms. Kaminsky(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A New Hope. It must be 1977: everyone is going to see Star Wars, including our friends from That '70s Show. Kelso is so fascinated by the film that he sees it again and again(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Water Tower. Eric's parents think he shows symptoms of being on drugs, but his demeanor is really an aftershock from seeing them having sex; Kelso blames Hyde for an injury incurred during a prank(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Punk Chick. Steve Hyde falls in love with Chrissy, a tough chick who is "Hyde" in female form - right down to the conspiracy theories(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Grandma's Dead. Immediately after Eric suggests to his grandmother that it wouldn't kill her to be nice, she dies, prompting different coping techniques within the Forman family(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Hyde Moves In. Growing up is bad enough, without having to do it in '70s America. Follow a group of friends as they do battle with hormones, parents and dodgy fashion(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Good Son. Houseguest Hyde becomes the perfect son, casting a dim light on Eric; Red sees his life pale in comparison to that of his service buddy (Mitch Pileggi). Joy: Arlene Pileggi. Midge: Tanya Roberts. Hyde: Danny Masterson. Eric: Topher Grace. Red: Kurtwood Smith(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Own Private Practice Guy. J.D. befriends a private practise doctor whom Dr. Cox loathes. Meanwhile, Turk and Dr. Kelso find alternative means of letting off work tension(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My T.C.W. J.D.'s romantic life has a new light (Amy Smart): a glow beside the flickering bulbs in the bickering relationships of fellow staffers. Nurse Paul: Rick Schroder. Jordan: Christa Miller Lawrence. Janitor: Neil Flynn(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Kingdom. JD risks his friendship with Turk in order to ingratiate himself with the surgeons, Paul gets the wrong end of the stick when Elliot says "I love U2", and Dr Cox tells everyone that Dr Kelso is dead(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Interpretation. J.D. has second thoughts about his relationship with Jamie, Turk is concerned by a sexy dream about Elliot, and Dr. Cox attempts to bond with Jordan's baby - is it his?(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Live and Let Dine. Archer, Lana and Cyril go on an undercover mission in a celebrity chef's kitchen(n)

programme.title: Archer

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione return to seek out more classics in need of restoration, beginning with a Porsche 928 that has suffered from years of water damage. The car's bubbled paintwork, seized brakes and rusting nuts, bolts and screws seem bad enough, but it gets worse when the vehicle's complicated electrics go haywire and trap Mario inside. Once Bernie and his team of mechanics have serviced the engine, the car is taken to a rolling road to put it through its paces, before former racing driver Paul O'Neill assesses its value to see if all the work has been worthwhile.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: The duo restore a Fiat 500, which was Italy's answer to the Mini when it was launched in July 1957 and marketed as a cheap, practical and fuel-efficient town car. Bernie Fineman immediately puts Mario Pacione's nose out of joint by spending £1,500 on a bright orange wreck that will not even start and makes matters worse by laying out another £2,000 behind his back to coax an extra six brake horsepower out of the 500cc engine. Former racing driver Paul O'Neill judges their efforts and decides whether Bernie's improvements make the difference between a profit and a loss. Plus, the car's history is charted through archive footage, revealing what inspired the designers and why their creation was such a success.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione set out to restore a 1960s VW camper van, but end up paying a small fortune for a rusty vehicle with no doors and a completely rotten interior. Halfway through the four-week project, extensive bodywork repairs and unexpected mechanical issues mean that there is no money left in the budget to refit the inside of the van - but one of the mechanics reveals a secret talent.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione are working to a tight deadline - and even tighter budget - to restore a Mercedes 450SL that has seen better days back to its former glory.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione decide to restore a 1970s VW Beetle, but after finding one at a good price it turns out to be rotten to the core when they take it back to their garage. Bernie is less than pleased with the purchase, but Mario's plan to put a two-litre engine into the vehicle's tiny engine bay brightens his mood.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione are working to a tight deadline, and even tighter budget, to restore a Ferrari that has seen better days to its former glory.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione set out to restore a DeLorean - one of the most recognisable cars of the 1980s due to its starring role in the classic movie Back to the Future. After finally tracking one down, they discover that the supposedly rust-resistant machine has been reduced to a shadow of its former self, while carelessness in the garage results in an additional bill for a replacement window.(n)

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione scour scrapheaps, wastelands and back yards to find classic cars in need of restoration. As well as finding the parts that can bring the vintage wrecks back to life, they learn about the stories behind the machines and reveal why they occupy an important place in automotive history.(n)

Bernie Fineman immediately puts Mario Pacione's nose out of joint by spending £1,500 on a bright orange wreck that will not even start and makes matters worse by laying out another £2,000 behind his back to coax an extra six brake horsepower out of the 500cc engine. Former racing driver Paul O'Neill judges their efforts and decides whether Bernie's improvements make the difference between a profit and a loss. Plus, the car's history is charted through archive footage, revealing what inspired the designers and why their creation was such a success.(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A former biker and drug dealer single-handedly takes on the nefarious Lord's Resistance Army in a noble bid to save young Sudanese refugees from a life of violence and suffering. Inspired by actual events, Marc Forster's Machine Gun Preacher stars Gerard Butler as Sam Childers, a tough-as-nails biker whose heart shatters upon witnessing the harrowing plight of children in Sudan. Determined that no child shall be enslaved by the brutal Lord's Resistance Army, Childers turns to God for inspiration, and establishes an orphanage for wounded kids and child soldiers. When the Lord's Resistance Army refuses to stand down, Childers organizes a militia to protect the children. In helping to give the orphans of war-torn Sudan a better future, the former outlaw begins to find new meaning in his own life as well(n)

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: An ocean-themed Florida amusement park comes under attack from an angry Great White shark in this third installment of the horror series. The film maintains only a loose relationship to the original Steven Spielberg hit, centering on Mike (Dennis Quaid) and Sean (John Putch), the sons of police chief Martin Brody (originally played by Roy Scheider). Mike works at Sea World, where a baby Great White shark has accidentially been let into the park. Soon, the baby's vicious and extremely powerful mother comes in search of her child. The film focuses most of its attention on the series of tense shark attacks that follow, as tourists run for their lives while the park workers struggle to destroy the sharp-toothed beast. The suspense sequences were made somewhat more memorable during the film's original release with 3-D photography, an attribute lost on video, thereby removing the most distinctive element of an otherwise run-of-the-mill sequel(n)

programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister(n)

programme.title: Love and a .45
programme.desc: Saga about fugitive lovers on the run from the police and assorted criminals(n)

programme.title: The Devil's Own
programme.desc: A policeman plays Good Samaritan to a visitor from Ireland, only to discover that he has a potentially deadly secret. Belfast-born Frankie McGuire (Brad Pitt) saw his father gunned down by enemy soldiers at the age of eight, and when he grew up he joined the Irish Republican Army, determined that one day his father's death would be avenged. An especially ruthless "volunteer," Frankie is responsible for the death of 13 British soldiers and 11 policemen. After a particularly bloody battle, Frankie sails to the United States in a ragged tugboat he has restored; with a huge bundle of cash, Frankie intends to buy a stock of Stinger missiles from an underground arms dealer in America, Billy Burke (Treat Williams). Upon arrival in New York, Frankie is met by a judge who is sympathetic to the IRA's cause and who arranges a place for him to stay. Using the name Rory Devaney, Frankie moves into the home of Tom O'Meara (Harrison Ford), a scrupulously honest cop. Tom is already in the midst of a personal crisis; his friend and partner Edwin Diaz (Ruben Blades) recently shot a man that he knew was unarmed in the line of duty, and while Edwin wants Tom to help him cover up the matter, Tom's conscience will not allow it. When Tom begins to realize that "Rory" is not simply a man running from the violence of his homeland, he's torn between his sympathy for Frankie's tragic childhood and his desire to see justice served and prevent needless death in Ireland(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Say It with Bullets. A woman asks the Team to investigate the murder of her brother. But the team is unaware of her prior deal with Decker: the A-Team for her brother's murderer(n)

programme.title: Officer Down
programme.desc: A corrupt cop gets a shot at redemption when the mystery man who saved his life during a botched drug bust seeks his help in stopping a madman who preys on strippers. Meanwhile, the officer realizes that his shady past is about to catch up with him, and schemes to cover up his own role in the crimes(n)

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: Set just three decades into the future, Alex Proyas's all-action science-fiction film is inspired by Isaac Asimov's 1950s short story. The science of robotics is so advanced that humanoid-looking servants have been developed, ready to obey any command from a human. When the chief designer of US Robotics, the biggest manufacturer of this new brand, is found dead in the company's atrium after a fall from the upper floor, it has all the hallmarks of suicide, and Chicago cop Del Spooner is assigned to the case. But technophobe Spooner doesn't believe that all robots are harmless. Despite opposition from both his superiors and the company, he investigates further and soon his suspicions centre on one robot, Sonny. Is 'he' one of an army of conscious, violent robots ready to challenge their human masters?(n)

programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez, Ice Cube, Jon Voight. Action adventure about a documentary film crew's encounter with a terrifying 40ft snake. Searching the Amazon basin for a legendary tribe never before captured on film, the crew fall in with an eccentric boat captain who claims to know the tribe's whereabouts. But he turns out to be obsessed with a deadly anaconda said to inhabit the local waters, leading the film crew along with him into a nightmare(n)

programme.title: Supercross
programme.desc: Charged performances by Steve Howey and Mike Vogel kick-start this high-octane thrill ride about driven motorcycle-racing brothers competing against each other on the professional circuit. K.C. Carlyle (Howey) lands a lucrative sponsorship with a factory team, but younger brother Trip (Vogel), the better rider, must make his way as an independent "privateer." Real-life motocross star Tyler Evans has a cameo as himself. Directed by Steve Boyum. Cameron Richardson, Sophia Bush, Robert Carradine(n)

programme.title: Crusoe
programme.desc: An exciting and insightful re-telling of the classic legend. programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Theatre.
programme.desc: Sharona asks Adrian to clear her sister Gail of murdering a fellow actor who died on stage in full view of a packed theatre audience. Determined to help, he agrees to do whatever it takes to unmask the real killer - but does not count on being recruited to tread the boards in place of the victim. Detective drama, guest starring Amy Sedaris, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A talented chef is poisoned during a culinary competition at an exclusive restaurant. After quizzing the other contestants, Jane discovers one of them encouraged the victim, a recovering alcoholic, to relapse in a bid to sabotage his chances, and learns he was in debt to a loan shark. However, it later emerges that a jealous partner could be to blame. Crime drama, guest starring Dina Meyer.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A scientist contacts Jane for help after being exposed to a deadly virus, leaving her with only a short time to live. He rushes to the facility where she works and compiles a list of possible suspects, including her husband - but later discovers the security systems have been tampered with, letting anyone enter the lab. It then emerges that a flask containing the toxin has been emptied in the staff room, threatening the entire team. Crime drama, guest starring Tony Curran (This Life).(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team infiltrates the corrupt world of corporate agriculture to recover an unlikely treasure - a one-of-a-kind stolen potato worth millions to the industry. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nathan and his colleagues plot to steal a revolutionary computer chip from a hi-tech family home. However, they change course mid-heist when their target's young child is abducted while visiting the carnival. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine lieutenant's body falls from the sky and the team links the man's death to the disappearance of a Navy chaplain thought to have been kidnapped by rebels working with Colombian crime cartels. Ziva and Tony are dispatched to conduct a rescue operation and enlist the help of former Interpol agent Monique Lisson, while Gibbs discovers there was more to the chaplain's outreach mission than meets the eye. Crime drama, guest starring Karina Lombard (The L Word) and Jamie Lee Curtis (A Fish Called Wanda).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A fire crew discovers a man's body after putting out a raging blaze at a warehouse belonging to a Navy-contracted electronics company, and Gibbs recognises the victim as Carter Plimpton - a former member of an NCIS black-ops unit. Meanwhile, a member of the Baltimore police department helping with the case appears to have a grudge against Tony.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead English tutor leads the team to uncover a plot to steal a priceless artefact from the British Museum, but the case is complicated by the appearance of a rogue police inspector from Scotland Yard. Lisbon also finds herself in the firing line when new CBI boss Madeleine Hightower holds her responsible for Jane's unconventional behaviour. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman with amnesia is found stumbling out of a Native American reservation with severe head injuries, leading the agents to discover three dead bodies. They conclude she was the intended fourth victim but managed to escape, so Jane uses post-hypnotic suggestion on her to try to flush out the killer. Elsewhere, Hightower gives Rigsby and Van Pelt an ultimatum. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nathan and the team take aim at a charming funeral director, who they discover not only embezzles money from her grieving clients, but also sells the identities of the recently deceased to a Mexican drug cartel. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The Leverage team strives to pull off its greatest scam when it tries to take out one of the members of a family of accomplished conmen. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. Meanwhile, Abby studies evidence relating to fire-starter Bruce Johnson, who died when his car exploded, and discovers coded messages in his quarters that indicate he may have been working as part of a larger gang. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Delilah is rushed to hospital when the stress of planning her wedding becomes too much for her. Meanwhile, the team investigates the unexplained death of a healthy petty officer.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers his first name is actually Justin while creating a checking account, and takes on the new moniker to create a younger, hipper alter-ego. The father then holds a party, where Quagmire unwittingly gets into trouble with his own mother.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Quagmire, Joe and Cleveland form a neighborhood detective agency, and are stunned to discover that Chris is a thief. Meanwhile, Lois is worried about Chris' delusional relationship with his new girlfriend, but also sees it as an opportunity for Peter to copy Chris' romantic gestures.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger steps in to become a new sidekick for Stan, who is given the cold shoulder by his so-called best buddy at a bachelor party in Atlantic City. Things go swimmingly until they return home to face Francine. Meanwhile, Hayley and Steve join forces to break up a good-looking couple.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan puts Steve on steroids to make him part of the in-crowd at school, but the medication has unexpected side-effects and he gets more attention than he bargained for. Meanwhile, Francine sets her heart on a new career as a doctor after Hayley makes a movie about her life.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers that he has a vestigial twin growing out of his neck and names him Chip. However, he soon becomes jealous of the attention the new arrival is receiving and decides to try to amputate his brother. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire finally meets a woman with a sexual appetite as insatiable as his, but things take a turn for the worse when she makes him her sex slave. Meanwhile, a love triangle emerges between Stewie, Brian and Stewie's teddy bear, Rupert.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Part one of two. Stan makes a complete mess of arranging a party for his boss - who responds by sending him to Saudi Arabia, where he and the family get an unwelcome taste of life overseas. American and Arabian social customs soon prove incompatible, and a gender war looms. With the voice of Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Part two of two. Stan begins to enjoy the power of living in a patriarchal culture, but the rest of the family members find it harder to become accustomed to Saudi Arabian life. Francine in particular struggles to adjust, and lands herself in trouble by staging a musical protest about gender roles.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg convinces Brian to take her SATs for her, but when she receives poor exam results everyone begins to question how smart the dog really is. Peter spends the day with the canine, showing him all the joys of being stupid, and the benefits of having a low IQ.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg is thrilled to be recruited as a model - but not everything is as it seems with the job. Meanwhile, Brian accompanies Stewie on a road trip adventure when the baby decides he wants to experience life outside of preschool.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine opens her own muffin shop when Stan fails to support her professional ambitions, giving her husband a taste of life without a housewife. In a desperate move, the inept agent transfers Klaus's brain back into a human body, but soon realises he has made a huge mistake. Meanwhile, Steve becomes convinced he is a teen werewolf.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan seeks revenge for an embarrassing incident at a high-school prom, in which he was humiliated on the dancefloor. His chance arrives when he attends a reunion with former homecoming queen Francine, but is devastated to discover two missing ballot papers mean that his wife never officially secured the crown.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy captain wearing a colourful costume underneath his uniform is shot and killed in a flower shop, and further investigation reveals he was leading a double life as a masked vigilante. Vance brings in Tony's ex-fiancee, journalist Wendy Miller, who claims the victim had been trying to expose a scandal, and as the team pursues the case, a real-estate scam is uncovered. Guest starring Perrey Reeves (Entourage).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy reservist is found dead in his home with marks around his neck, and Gibbs and the team discover he was working on a highly classified case for the department of defence. The circumstances surrounding the man's demise lead the investigators to suspect someone was secretly trying to drive him insane, bringing them into contact with Samantha Ryan, the director of a division specialising in psychological warfare. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Chief petty officer Leland Wiley dies of a heart attack just as he is about to reveal information on elusive arms dealer Agah Bayar. The team discovers the cardiac arrest was caused by someone hacking into a computer monitoring Wiley's pacemaker and increasing his heart rate to 400bpm. Meanwhile, a probationary agent tries to impress Gibbs and win a place on his team. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with Tamer Hassan and Matt L Jones.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Confidential files are leaked by an anonymous hacker, who threatens to release more unless the Navy agrees to renew a contract with a struggling shipbuilding firm. The Navy Secretary suspects the company's owner Philip Wickes is to blame, and asks NCIS to join forces with the PsyOps unit in an elaborate ruse to bring the culprit out of hiding. Meanwhile, Gibbs' colleagues begin to notice his attraction to his opposite number Samantha Ryan. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine Sergeant is found dead in a national park, forcing Gibbs and his team to collaborate with Mounted Police Sergeant May Dawson to solve a string of related crimes.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The murder of a trainer at a baseball academy leads Cho, Lisbon and Jane to suspect the crime could have been motivated by money. The team learns his wife is sole beneficiary of a substantial life insurance payout, and his business partner stood to take the controlling share of their company - but a lack of evidence hampers the investigation - until the consultant follows a hunch. Jane also has a flashback when he is knocked out, leading him to remember working at a circus with his father. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.(n)

Western, starring Victor Mature, Robert Preston and Anne Bancroft.(n)
