Comedy based on the TV series, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale, Peter Vaughan, Fulton Mackay and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Fair Game
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller set in the build-up to the Iraq war. CIA agent Valerie Plame's former diplomat husband is sent to investigate rumours of Saddam Hussein trying to buy radioactive materials. His discovery that no such materials exist is flatly ignored, leading him to publicly condemn the Bush administration's eagerness to wage war. However, their lives are endangered when Valerie's identity is leaked to the media. With Naomi Watts and Sean Penn.(n)

programme.title: The Mechanic

Action thriller remake, starring Jason Statham, Ben Foster and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Raid 2

Action thriller sequel, starring Iko Uwais and Arifin Putra. In Indonesian, Japanese, English and Arabic.(n)

Crime thriller, with James Frecheville, Guy Pearce, Jacki Weaver and Ben Mendelsohn.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock

Comedy from director Richard Linklater, starring Jack Black, Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman.(n)

Comedy, with Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Joan Sims, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey, Shirley Eaton and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A top secret device goes missing, and the bungling spy is teamed up with a brash American agent to recover it.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy makes plans to seduce Veronica at his bring-a-bottle party, though he must first get his parents to go on a second honeymoon. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet's prayers are answered when George accidentally erases his own memory, forgets all about his super-powers and becomes a model husband and father. But scientists soon get wind of a meteor on a collision course with Earth - if Thermoman doesn't remember where he's put his tights within 24 hours, all human life will be destroyed. Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce star.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen Barry's Midlife Crisis?.
programme.desc: Truly's plans to rescue Howard from his bedroom are given a boost when Auntie Wainwright puts some lightweight scaffolding up for sale - ideal for springing someone imprisoned on an upper floor. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey takes a fancy to an Australian backpacker, but a cantankerous Ben is unhappy about the situation. Comedy, guest starring Ben Uttley, with Daniela Denby-Ashe and Robert Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet's prayers are answered when George accidentally erases his own memory, forgets all about his super-powers and becomes a model husband and father. But scientists soon get wind of a meteor on a collision course with Earth - if Thermoman doesn't remember where he's put his tights within 24 hours, all human life will be destroyed. Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce star.(n)

programme.desc: Timothy makes plans to seduce Veronica at his bring-a-bottle party, though he must first get his parents to go on a second honeymoon. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi.
programme.desc: Billy promises the gang a perfect barbecue in the great outdoors - without a newfangled portable contraption - and takes Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle into the Dales. He knows the ideal spot - if he can just remember how to find it. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie.
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?.
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey takes a fancy to an Australian backpacker, but a cantankerous Ben is unhappy about the situation. Comedy, guest starring Ben Uttley, with Daniela Denby-Ashe and Robert Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his alternative method causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara introduce livestock into suburban Surbiton - an idea that does not go down too well with the neighbours. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Nana is in mourning for her friend Elsie, but her grief tries Jim's patience as she drowns her sorrows with brandy. Liz Smith and Ricky Tomlinson star.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Jim and Nana fight over who is going to use the toilet first and Antony displays his juggling skills with potatoes, while Dave shows everyone an amazing trick involving his middle finger. Comedy, starring Ralf Little and Ricky Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: It is St Stephen's Day and Eamon's mother has called over to make her daughter-in-law's life even more miserable. But when Bridget accidentally kills her with an electric carving knife, she and Eamon have to hide the body from all the neighbours, and the Gardai. Guest starring Katherine Lynch.(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three single women dabble in magic to conjure up the perfect lover, and unintentionally summon Satan himself, who seduces them one by one. They come to realise the danger the lecherous devil presents and decide to end their relationships, but the infernal rogue does not take kindly to rejection. Fantasy comedy based on John Updike's novel, with Jack Nicholson, Cher, Michelle Pfeiffer and Susan Sarandon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: Comic skits and sketches, with Amelia Bullmore, Julia Davis, Simon Pegg, Mark Heap and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: Comic skits and sketches, with Amelia Bullmore, Julia Davis, Simon Pegg, Mark Heap and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: Hugh Bonneville presents the first of a five-part series looking back at the troupe's most popular sketches, with interjections from some of the biggest names in comedy revealing what makes Monty Python so special and how they have influenced their own careers. Contributors include Stephen Fry, Matt Lucas, Simon Pegg, Steve Coogan, Eddie Izzard, Chevy Chase and Bill Bailey.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A top secret device goes missing, and the bungling spy is teamed up with a brash American agent to recover it.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band.
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret prepare for a holiday in Athens - but their preparations are delayed by an unhelpful electricity board representative, as well as an escaped snake. Starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with a guest appearance by Clive Mantle.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi.
programme.desc: Billy promises the gang a perfect barbecue in the great outdoors - without a newfangled portable contraption - and takes Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle into the Dales. He knows the ideal spot - if he can just remember how to find it. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney's Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivan's comedy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan fancies a holiday, but Mr Khan refuses to dip into the couple's `rainy day' fund - especially when they still have daughter Shazia's honeymoon to pay for. However, a meeting at the local mosque provides an unusual solution. Comedy, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Manny's parents come to stay, and Bernard strives to get rid of them, while Fran has her own reasons for wanting them to leave. It soon becomes clear that Manny may not have been completely honest about his achievements. Comedy, guest starring Annette Crosbie (One Foot in the Grave) and Sam Kelly ('Allo 'Allo!).(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: As if smoking and drinking heavily were not bad enough, a bet on the Grand National sends Bernard spiralling into yet another addiction - gambling. As his ailing finances suffer the consequences of his latest vice, he decides it is time to actually sell some books - but it may be too late. Guest starring Keith Allen, with Dylan Moran and Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: The celebrity cooks continue travelling across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen and out-perform the opposition. Their talents are judged by chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining home-bakers must steel themselves to face the full force of Paul Hollywood's discerning eye as Bread week arrives. For the signature bake, the contestants are given an hour-and-a-half to prepare quick breads with no proving - which results in creative flavours such as sweet chocolate loaves and manchego and prosciutto-stuffed bread coming to the fore. Next up is the technical challenge, in which Paul lulls the bakers into a false sense of security by asking them to make baguettes, a relatively simple task that concludes with `the male judge' delivering one of his most brutal verdicts yet. Finally, a bicycle, a snake, a lion and even Brighton Pavilion find their way into the tent's ovens as the showstopper challenge sees the competitors crafting edible 3D bread sculptures.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first pair of semi-finalists are sent to Mayfair's Connaught Hotel to work a shift in the two Michelin-starred kitchen of French chef Helene Darroze, who then asks them to make her signature dish featuring calamari, blue lobster, clams, black squid ink, acquerello rice and Parmigiano-Reggiano foam. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who will pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create gourmet lunches on a tight budget, receiving tips from one of Britain's leading Indian chefs and getting insider advice on buying wine on a shoestring. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise meal for a dinner lady.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his 900-mile road trip from Venice to Istanbul, sampling that array of gastronomic delights that lie on the route. In the penultimate episode Rick arrives in the Greek Peloponnese where he samples mouth-watering dishes such as rooster stew hilopites with mizithra cheese, and a home-made moussaka he claims is the best he have ever savoured. In his Symi island kitchen, Rick rolls up his sleeves to prepare galaktoboureko, a dessert of semolina custard in filo pastry, a favourite dish in Greece.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: The Guests from Loughborough eat a diet of convenience food that is not only unwholesome, it is also very expensive. Mum Lisa is aware she has to make her family more healthy, but is going about it the wrong way, buying into costly `superfoods' rather than good old-fashioned fruit and veg. Can Gregg and Chris help the Guests bring more variety to their plates - and in turn, knock a whopping 50 per cent off their shopping bill? Along the way, they also investigate how canned fish compares to fresh and which oil is best for cooking, as well as the diet cons to watch out for.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finalists really have their imaginations put to the test this evening as John Torode and Gregg Wallace ask them to rustle up a dish using scraps, trimmings and leftovers. The ingredients include chicken giblets and skin, bones, pigs' ears, fish heads and bones, potato peelings and stale bread, so they need to use their ingenuity as well as their skill - and for one, it'll be the last dish they ever make on MasterChef. The rest are left to prepare a six-course menu for an esteemed group of experts who make their living analysing food and drink - so they won't be easy to please.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough week of semi-finals, the best six amateur cooks remain, but there are only five places in next week's finals. Now they face the last challenge to decide who will go through - a single showstopping dish to win over three of the country's leading restaurant critics, Tracey MacLeod, William Sitwell and Charles Campion. At the end of the service, it's down to John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide who deserves a place in the final.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies
programme.desc: Chefs Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson come to the aid of hungry priests at Westminster Cathedral by preparing a range of dishes using fruit and vegetables, including traditional bubble and squeak, hot stuffed artichokes and tomato summer pudding.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: Keith visits Santa Fe, where he cooks pork and black beans for the local cowboys, before dining at a tapas restaurant where the waiters sing opera. He also takes part in a chilli cook-off and visits a tapas restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef travels to Austin, Texas, where he visits the ranch of Larry and Shelly Beard to cook a steak with hot sauce and makes the perfect margarita. He also goes to the Big Wheel restaurant, where breakfast is prepared for truckers, and cooks chicken fajitas.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef visits the Sonoma Valley and San Francisco in California, for a rendezvous at Alioto's Restaurant in the fisherman's wharf to cook a Sicilian dish and meet owner Nuncio Alioto. He heads on to the Ironhouse vineyard for a display of local produce, and serves up a meal for one of the owners, Forrect Tancer, before dropping into Chinatown for a guided tour with Shirley Fong-Torres.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd is off to Cornwall to visit a field kitchen at HMS Raleigh, the new-entry training establishment for all ratings joining the Royal Navy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd prepares chicken with peppers and cream for the crew of a French trawler in Newlyn, Cornwall, and rustles up pork Normande for the owner of a pig farm. The chef also meets the man in charge of the Cornish Smoked Fish Co in Chatlestown.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Enzo Mauro at his restaurant in Newbridge, Penzance, where he also talks to Nick Howells about salted pilchards. He then heads to Botallack Count House to cook rabbit, and spends time cooking shark steak in pinquant tomato sauce with Rick Stein at the Seafood Restaurant in Padstow.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd cooks boeuf en daube and pollacks in green pepper sauce at the home of Trish Norris in Newquay.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finalists really have their imaginations put to the test this evening as John Torode and Gregg Wallace ask them to rustle up a dish using scraps, trimmings and leftovers. The ingredients include chicken giblets and skin, bones, pigs' ears, fish heads and bones, potato peelings and stale bread, so they need to use their ingenuity as well as their skill - and for one, it'll be the last dish they ever make on MasterChef. The rest are left to prepare a six-course menu for an esteemed group of experts who make their living analysing food and drink - so they won't be easy to please.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough week of semi-finals, the best six amateur cooks remain, but there are only five places in next week's finals. Now they face the last challenge to decide who will go through - a single showstopping dish to win over three of the country's leading restaurant critics, Tracey MacLeod, William Sitwell and Charles Campion. At the end of the service, it's down to John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide who deserves a place in the final.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Four siblings -- Edmund (Skandar Keynes), Lucy (Georgie Henley), Peter (William Moseley), and Susan (Anna Popplewell) -- are sent from their London home to the country estate of an eccentric professor in order to ensure their safety during World War II. The house is very dull, except for a large, ornate wardrobe discovered by young Lucy during a game of hide-and-seek. Venturing inside of it in the hopes of finding a hiding place, Lucy is transported to a snowy alternate universe: a magical world called Narnia. The land is populated by talking animals and ruled over by the benevolent lion god Aslan (voiced by Liam Neeson), but sadly, the world is also in a state of perpetual winter. The white witch Jadis (Tilda Swinton), lustful for power and governed by narcissism, has cursed Narnia with a tyrannical decree that it will always be winter but never Christmas. Now, the children must fight alongside Aslan for the salvation of Narnia, but one of them, seduced by the charisma of the white witch, may choose to fight on the wrong side(n)

programme.desc: Bridget worries about her relationship with Darcy and is upset when work reunites her with the womanising Daniel(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakdown
programme.desc: A trio of thirtysomething friends (Amy Poehler, Rachel Dratch, and Parker Posey) go vacationing at a popular spring break resort frequented by college coeds in order to prevent a politician's daughter from embarrassing her family. Larry Kennar and Rick Berg produce a script penned by director Ryan Shiraki in collaboration with star Dratch(n)

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: Two rodeo stars head to New York in search of a missing friend(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Alien: Covenant'
programme.desc: A look at "Alien: Covenant," a 2017 sci-fi thriller about a spaceship crew that encounters dangerous creatures while exploring a seemingly idyllic world. The film stars Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston and Billy Crudup, and is directed by Ridley Scott(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Loved-up newlyweds, Sarah and Tom, experience the honeymoon from hell when her disapproving family dispatch Sarah's ex-boyfriend to undo the marital knot(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: The Huntsman and his secret lover Sara attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: The spy spoof series gets the big screen treatment with this action comedy(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: When a band of mysterious horse-riding warlords raid the Yaghal camp and kidnaps the beautiful Evolet along with many others, young mammoth hunter D'Leh is forced to lead a small group of hunters south to save her. Driven by destiny, the unlikely band of warriors must also battle saber-toothed cats and terror birds(n)

programme.sub-title: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro
programme.desc: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro. Cord Jefferson examines the U.S. judicial system and how public defenders struggle to do their jobs; Ben Anderson reports on the battle over natural resources in the Peruvian Amazon(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip(n)
A look at the June 17 light-heavyweight rematch between Andre Ward and Sergey Kovalev in Las Vegas(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Four siblings -- Edmund (Skandar Keynes), Lucy (Georgie Henley), Peter (William Moseley), and Susan (Anna Popplewell) -- are sent from their London home to the country estate of an eccentric professor in order to ensure their safety during World War II. The house is very dull, except for a large, ornate wardrobe discovered by young Lucy during a game of hide-and-seek. Venturing inside of it in the hopes of finding a hiding place, Lucy is transported to a snowy alternate universe: a magical world called Narnia. The land is populated by talking animals and ruled over by the benevolent lion god Aslan (voiced by Liam Neeson), but sadly, the world is also in a state of perpetual winter. The white witch Jadis (Tilda Swinton), lustful for power and governed by narcissism, has cursed Narnia with a tyrannical decree that it will always be winter but never Christmas. Now, the children must fight alongside Aslan for the salvation of Narnia, but one of them, seduced by the charisma of the white witch, may choose to fight on the wrong side(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: When evil aliens led by Gallaxhar threaten to take over Earth, the US government unleashes a motley crew of monsters to stop them(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Elmo and Rosita's Rainbow Search. Elmo spots a rainbow and wants to show it to Rosita, who has never witnessed one, but it disappears before she can see it(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Rocking Rollie. Rosita and Zoe build a machine to help rock Rollie's cradle so their arms won't get tired(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Through a series of misunderstandings, Alvin, Simon and Theodore come to believe that Dave is going to propose to his new girlfriend in New York City and dump them. They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Superman and Batman clash in this superhero movie(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations in this intelligent thriller. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: This sequel is better, funnier, scarier and superior to the first indie gore-fest. Never before has there been such an originally funny and unique horror film that never for a moment takes itself seriously. Lots of fun!(n)

programme.title: Pete Holmes: Faces and Sounds
programme.desc: Comedian Pete Holmes performs in Chicago at the Vic Theatre. Topics include sleeping; strip clubs; flight attire; pornography; and going to an Enrique Iglesias concert(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars as troubled student Max Fischer, competing with grumpy Bill Murray for the love of a beautiful teacher(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: Gil Buckman is determined to have a better relationship with his three children than he had with his tough father. Elsewhere, his two sisters are also having family problems - one is struggling to understand her two troubled teenagers, while the other's husband wants to turn their toddler into a child genius(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Sweeping romantic epic, set at the end of World War II, in which a badly burnt and unidentified pilot recounts to the nurse tending him the story of a doomed love affair with a colleague's wife. Adapted from Michael Ondaatje's Booker Prize-winning novel, the film won nine Oscars, including Best Picture, Director and Supporting Actress(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison in this uproarious comedy. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.desc: The Bicameral Mind. In the Series 1 finale, an ambitious new narrative is revealed by Ford; Dolores embraces her identity; and Maeve's plan begins to take shape(n)

programme.desc: The Book of Kevin. programme.title: The Leftovers

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: Clubland is an Australian feature about Jean Dwight, once a promising star in England, who now lives in Australia with her two sons, 21-year old Tim and the younger Mark who suffers from a mild brain injury. She works long hours at a café and then stand-up at night, trying to have her second chance at fame. Mark takes most of the responsibility for his brother and tries to balance his demanding home life with his new girlfriend(n)

programme.desc: A chauffeur kidnaps his rich boss's dog to hold it for ransom, but when she accidentally gets the dog back, she thinks that it's the chauffeur that has been kidnapped(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Brothers try to raise money for a Chicago orphanage by getting their blues band back together(n)

programme.title: Innerspace
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure. Soon after pilot Tuck Pendleton and his craft are miniaturised in a scientific experiment, thieves try to steal the technology used, so a scientist injects Tuck into the nearest available body - which turns out to be that of hypochondriac Jack Putter. Now Tuck and Jack must work together to foil the criminals and extract Tuck before his oxygen runs out(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Ben Finn Finnegan is a treasure hunter who has made it his mission in life to track down the Queen's Dowry -- a legendary collection of 40 chests filled with priceless treasure, and lost at sea in 1715. But in his single-minded quest to track down this sizable booty, Finn has sadly neglected his marriage to his loving wife Tess. Tess has grown tired of the hunt, and now she's looking to start her life anew by going to work on the massive yacht of globetrotting billionaire Nigel Honeycutt(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A private investigator and a hired enforcer team up to solve the case of a missing girl and the alleged suicide of a once-prominent porn star, but they begin to uncover a conspiracy instead(n)

programme.title: Making 'Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising'
programme.desc: A look at "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising," a sequel to the 2014 comedy that finds a young couple plagued by yet another Greek menace: the sisters of Kappa Kappa Nu. The film stars Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Chloë Grace Moretz, and is directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
programme.desc: The easily offended might do best to avoid Jim Jefferies' raunchy, rude humor (or at least imbibe the two-drink minimum beforehand), but the Australian-born comedian provides plenty of laughs for everyone else in this HBO special. In I Swear to God, Jefferies continues his patented brand of comedy that once got him punched by an audience member, discussing the idiocy of no-smoking signs, sluts vs. studs, and his father's Holocaust jokes(n)

programme.title: Friday

programme.title: Next Friday

This would be a good time to chill out in the suburbs with cousin Mike Epps and uncle Don 'Dc' Curry, who happens to have won the lottery but, as he finds out, money can't buy you love or security in Steve Carr's smart comedy(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Jack and the Beanstalk. Jack and the Beanstalk is a classic story that transcends ethnic boundaries. After all, foolishness knows no color. Happily Ever After demonstrates this with an African-American retelling of the fairy tale. When Jack comes across some magic beans, he unwittingly plants danger in the backyard. HBO originally presented this universal program featuring the voices of Robert Guillaume, Harry Belafonte, and Tone-Loc. Jack must use his wits and luck to escape the rhyming giant. When he does, he learns a valuable lesson about greed. Jack and the Beanstalk is recommended for ages four to nine(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Gina Prince-Bythewood's adaptation of Sue Monk Kidd's novel The Secret Life of Bees stars Dakota Fanning as Lily, a 14-year-old growing up in a small Southern town in 1964. She is haunted by memories of shooting her mother when she was a young girl. Lily lives with her emotionally distant father, and her best friend is their African-American housekeeper Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson). After locals beat Rosaleen for attempting to register as a voter, and Lily's dad goes one step too far during an argument with his daughter, Lily and Rosaleen set out to find the place where the only picture Lily has of her mother was taken. That place turns out to be the home of the independent Boatwright sisters, a trio -- Queen Latifah, Sophie Okonedo, and Alicia Keys -- who make a very successful living producing honey. Lily and her friend move in with them, and soon the girl learns about both beekeeping and life(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: Set in the Bedford-Stuyvesant area of Brooklyn, Spike Lee's thought-provoking and powerful comedy/drama chronicles the events that lead up to a race riot between the residents. The action takes place on the hottest day of the year and centers around a pizza parlor owned by Italian-American Sal. It's a popular hangout for the neighborhood youth. The events leading up to the confrontation are presented episodically and center around, Sal (Danny Aiello), his aimless employee Mookie (Spike Lee) and his pal, the radical Buggin Out (Giancarlo Esposito), who is irritated that Sal's "Wall of Fame" (containing only pictures of famous Italian-Americans) contains no African-American faces and therefore tries unsuccessfully to get the neighborhood blacks, including Mookie, to boycott the restaurant. Radio Raheem, with his blaring boom box permanently affixed to his shoulder, inadvertently becomes the catalyst for violence. As the stories unfold and many colorful satellite characters and their lives are introduced, the temperature rises. With the constant bickering between Mookie and the other employees, the harassment of Buggin Out, and other events, Sal is pushed to the breaking point and makes a fateful decision. Already stressed out and overheated, Sal snaps at closing time when Radio Raheem show up and demands service at the last minute. Violence and tragedy ensue(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Actor. Season Five of Monk begins as San Francisco's most efficient--and most obsessive-compulsive--private detective Adrian Monk (Tony Shalhoub) finds himself the central character of an upcoming movie. Much to Monk's relief, he won't be forced to play himself: Instead, the role of Monk has gone to Hollywood superstar David Ruskin (Stanley Tucci). Unfortunately, Ruskin is one of those method actors who insists upon meticulous pre-film research, and soon he is relentlessly dogging Monk's trail during a murder investigation. At first, Monk doesn't seem to mind, and actually enjoys showing off for Ruskin's benefit--but things take a sinister turn when Ruskin so loses himself in the role of "Adrian Monk" that he tries to exact his own personal vengeance against a suspect in the long-ago murder of Monk's wife Trudy!(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Garbage Strike
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Garbage Strike. San Francisco's bin men go on strike, plunging Monk into a frenzy of loathing as rubbish begins piling up in the streets - and making it hard for him to concentrate on solving the murder of a union official(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Big Game
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Big Game. Everyone is thrown for a loop (or is it a hoop?) when Lynn Hayden (Samantha Smith), Julie Teeger's much-admired high school basketball coach, dies in what seems to be a freak accident with a hair dryer. Monk (Tony Shalhoub) of course suspects murder, but this seems unlikely since Lynn apparently had no enemies. To get to the truth, Monk signs up as assistant to the school's interim coach, who happens to be Julie's mom (and Monk's caregiver) Natalie (Traylor Howard). Amidst a great deal of personal agony over having to actually stoop to physical exertion (and in a sweaty, smelly high school gym to boot) Monk uncovers a link between Lynn's demise and a recent forest fire--to say nothing of a similarly suspicious death at a country club three years before(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Can't See a Thing
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Can't See a Thing. While visiting his elderly friend Rusty (Art Evans) at his neighborhood firehouse, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is blinded by the same intruder who kills Rusty. Despite facing the probability of permanent sightlessness, Monk insists upon solving the old man's murder, using his previously unexploited "sixth sense" to harvest clues. It turns out that there is a connection between Rusty's missing coat and helmet, and another fire that occurred at the same time as the murder. In a fit of hubris (he actually seems to thrive on being blind), Monk not only captures the killer, but also figures out that the culprit didn't act alone...and that there's a lot more to the story than a mere murder(n)

programme.desc: After weeks of tough auditions and five fiercely competitive semi-finals, the national talent search comes to a close as the remaining acts perform one last time. Memory duo DNA, singer Kyle Tomlinson, magicians Issy Simpson and Matt Edwards, young comedian Ned Woodman, pianist Tokio Myers, dance group Mersey Girls, veteran singers the Pensionalities, comedian Daliso Chaponda and the Missing People Choir are the hopefuls - plus the wildcard chosen by Simon Cowell, David Walliams, Amanda Holden and Alesha Dixon. The aim of the finalists is to win a slot at this year's Royal Variety Performance and get their hands on the £250,000 cash prize. All they have to do is impress the viewers at home. Presented by Ant and Dec. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the women's singles final on the 14th day's play at Roland Garros, which was won by Garbine Muguruza last year. The Spaniard, whose previous best finish at a Grand Slam came when she finished runner-up to Serena Williams at Wimbledon in 2015, picked up her first and so far only Major victory with a 7-5, 6-4 over the American last year. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier and Martina Navratilova, commentary by Nick Mullins and Sam Smith and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.sub-title: World Cup Qualifier Live: Scotland v England.
programme.desc: Scotland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the Group F fixture, which takes place at Hampden Park, as the old rivals meet for the 114th time. Gordon Strachan will know victory - or at the very least a draw - is imperative here if his men are to stand a realistic chance of qualification, while a win for Gareth Southgate would put England in a dominant position in their quest to reach the finals in Russia. This is the first meeting between the sides on this ground since November 1999, when Kevin Keegan's England secured a 2-0 victory in the first leg of a UEFA Euro 2000 play-off thanks to a brace from Manchester United midfielder Paul Scholes. Presented by Mark Pougatch, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley, Glenn Hoddle and Kevin Gallacher, and analysis from Ian Wright, Ally McCoist, Lee Dixon and Ryan Giggs.(n)

Up for grabs this time is a £30,000 prize to contribute to the winning child's musical education, along with a family holiday to Disneyland Paris.(n)

programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Mead's elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin & Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple

programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading `They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.desc: Cardale prepares for Andrew and Erica's wedding, but a health scare at the local old people's home tests everyone to the limit. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.desc: Things are looking rosy for Carol and Proctor, who have recently become engaged, but Duggan is not so easily swayed from his devious plans and begins to work his charm on Carol, as well as working on a deal that could spell the end of Albery Glass forever. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Unaware of Carol's infidelities, Proctor exposes Duggan's conniving and confronts him about his reasons for wanting to sabotage the company - at the risk of revealing his own dark secrets in the process. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Mike's chances of getting the registrar job are jeopardised by his recent mistake, and Cathy's departure leaves him feeling even worse. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Wexford
programme.desc: The inspector ventures into the sensitive area of race relations to investigate the disappearance of a Nigerian doctor's daughter. The murder of a Job Centre clerk gives him his first clue - but cracking the case promises to be far from easy. Drama, also starring Christopher Ravenscroft as Wexford's trusty sidekick DI Burden, with Jane Lapotaire, Robin Kermode and George Harris.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew takes up rally driving in the desperate hope it will help him forget Erica. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Adrian Lukis and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The new sergeant's arrival could mean radical changes for Greengrass, and everyone is under suspicion when a girl reports a stalker in the village.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A no-nonsense risk manager arrives to investigate the Ronny Davidson case, putting the whole department under strain in the absence of holiday-makers Christine and Jack. Mike clashes with Robert over a patient he dismissed as just another drug addict when it turns out the youngster is suffering from sickle cell anaemia. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The detective is drawn into the criminal underworld of Soho when he reluctantly accepts an unofficial request from Chief Superintendent Rydell to find his missing daughter. Meanwhile, an armed robbery in Eastvale turns into a murder investigation after the perpetrator is found dead in his home and when a battered body is found in a local nightclub, the identity of the victim leads Banks and Cabbot to a devastating realisation about both cases.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. A surveillance operation establishes a clear link between the murders of Charles McKay and Barry Clough and the subsequent investigation takes a number of alarming twists before uncovering a conspiracy pointing to one of the team being an informer. As Banks pushes all the suspects hard, the case threatens to undermine his integrity as an officer and brings his relationship with Cabbot to breaking point. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: Bradfield sees a chance to get revenge on Clifford and diverts the team to carry out surveillance on the Bentleys - and when Tennison learns of the operation, she is forced to make a split-second decision as to what is most important, her career or her family? As Bradfield uncovers more details about the heist, he faces the disapproval of his colleagues as he becomes determined to catch them in the act.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers her ex-partner is the defending barrister for Georgios Stelikos, a man on trial for rape and murder, and she is horrified when the accused escapes conviction. When Stelikos is later found dead, the prime suspect is Hannah Conway, who made public death threats against him after giving evidence for the prosecution in court. Meanwhile, Janet tries to support her colleague following devastating news. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A shop assistant is hospitalised following an armed robbery, and DI Preston begins to suspect that one of the woman's colleagues played a part in the hold-up. Meanwhile, footage of a drug dealer's car links him to the crime, so officers put pressure on his girlfriend to confess what she knows. Drama, starring Jane Antrobus, Marc Silcock and Zoe Lister.(n)

programme.title: Homefront
programme.desc: The day of Matt's inquest has arrived and Paula wants answers. Her son Tom is sent home from Afghanistan to give evidence about his brother's death and commanding officer Pete advises him to stick to his original witness statement. The question is, will Tom toe the line or tell the truth and risk hurting those he loves the most?.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The inspector is called to investigate the death of a man who was shot in his bedroom. A lack of real evidence soon draws Maigret's suspicions toward a female house-guest of the deceased - who was also the beneficiary of his will. Crime drama, starring Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A no-nonsense risk manager arrives to investigate the Ronny Davidson case, putting the whole department under strain in the absence of holiday-makers Christine and Jack. Mike clashes with Robert over a patient he dismissed as just another drug addict when it turns out the youngster is suffering from sickle cell anaemia. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew stops dithering and proposes to Erica, but his mind is soon distracted from romance by the plight of a priest suffering from a mystery illness. While he's wondering what course of action to take, Nick continues his scheming and David becomes increasingly concerned about Clare's mental state, fearing she's about to be overtaken by manic depression again. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham and Adrian Lukis star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Stuart has a lot of explaining to do when a medical procedure goes badly wrong, and Jack is quick to use the blunder as an example of Robert's lack of leadership. Meanwhile, Judy learns her father's cancer has returned, and Andrew remains traumatised by recent events, causing him to shirk his responsibilities. Sam and Mike revel in the fact that they're hospital gossip. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack decides to implement a new policy and Richard comes to suspect he and Christine are working as a team in more ways than one. Robert goes on the warpath over the new protocol and threatens to hand in his notice. Meanwhile, Judy's worst fears are confirmed after her father's operation, and the powers that be conspire to cover up a case of steroid abuse by a VIP's son. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Kavanagh defends a left-wing activist accused of murdering someone from the opposite end of the political spectrum - and learns a harsh lesson in the process. To make matters worse, he finds out daughter Kate is having an affair with her married tutor, thus setting the scene for further fireworks. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while miscellaneous bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wife's death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son con-men. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl takes an overdose and Blaketon's mysterious private life comes to light when his car goes missing and is involved in an accident. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star.(n)

programme.desc: The outlaws are attacked by a group of angry Crusaders who believe Robin is a thief. Michael Praed stars.(n)

programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey).(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators join forces with Texas police officers in an attempt to break up one of the biggest dog-fighting rings in American history.(n)

programme.desc: How DNA and ballistics analysis using cutting-edge technology are being used to bring criminals to justice.(n)

programme.desc: The use of forensic technology in the search for some of America's 1.8 million missing persons, from runaways who find their way home to those who vanish for ever without trace.(n)

programme.desc: The case of AC/DC drummer Phil Rudd, who was charged with drug possession and threatening to kill. Plus, a Philippine president who laundered billions of dollars of stolen public funds.(n)

programme.desc: A case in which a preacher was ambushed and murdered. His former lover was arrested and convicted of the crime, but the victim's dying words might have provided the key to exonerating the man he once loved.(n)

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: A case in which the pregnant teenage mistress of policeman James Kulbicki was found dead. Fellow officers believed he may have killed her to keep the affair quiet.(n)

programme.title: Murder Chose Me
programme.desc: Detective Rod Demery relives the circumstances of his then-21-year-old mother's death. Barbara Demery Armstead died of shotgun wounds in May 1969 and at the time Rod was told it was a botched robbery. However, that explanation was not correct and it wasn't until much later he discovered the full facts.(n)

programme.title: Casey Anthony: An American Murder Mystery

Investigators, however, soon discover that the child has been missing for 31 days.(n)

programme.title: Casey Anthony: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Recounting one of the most talked-about cases in US legal history. As the trial began, the defence unleashed shocking allegations about Caylee and Casey's father - and the prosecution theorised on how Caylee died.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Broath. Barney tries to persuade his friends to meet Quinn and get to know her properly. However, Ted is convinced that Quinn is only after Barney's money and breaks his promise to keep her job a secret, telling everyone that she's a stripper. The gang do their utmost to divide Barney and Quinn, but end up regretting their actions. Meanwhile, Ted and Robin attempt to repair their friendship, and Marshall and Lily reveal a little too much information about their sex life(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Trilogy Time. When Barney and Quinn start living together, Barney's reluctance to throw out any of his old possessions makes the gang doubt his faith in the relationship. Ted, Marshall and Barney hold their triennial 'trilogy time' event, at which they watch the Star Wars film trilogy and try to picture how their lives will have developed in another three years. The discussion leads Barney to realise that his hopes for the future have changed radically since meeting Quinn(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Band-Aid Covers the Bullet Hole. Bailey (Chandra Wilson) refuses to stay on maternity leave, saddling a reluctant Cristina (Sandra Oh) with babysitting duty--as if Cristina doesn't have enough trouble with Burke (Isaiah Washington). Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) has yet to get over her night with George (T.R. Knight), while Derek (Patrick Dempsey) and Addison (Kate Walsh) can't get past the problem of Mark Sloan. In a similar "triangle" situation, Alex (Justin Chambers) feels like the proverbial fifth wheel out as Izzie (Katherine Heigl) and Denny (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) grow closer. Meanwhile, the roster of patients is a strange one indeed, ranging from a terminal ill woman (Anne Moore) with a fork stuck in her neck, and a hockey player (Teddy Dunn) who demands that Callie (Sara Ramirez) amputate his least useful finger(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy

programme.desc: In the first episode of the London-based comedy, Irish teacher Sharon picks up American Rob for a weekend tryst; and learns, after he's returned State-side, that she's pregnant. He returns to the U.K. upon learning the news; and they set out to turn their brief encounter into a serious commitment(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob Delaney (comedian and best-selling author) and Sharon Horgan (award-winning actress and star/ co-writer of Pulling) write and star in Catastrophe, a new six-part comedy that follows an American man and an Irish woman who make a bloody mess as they struggle to fall in love in London. In episode two, Sharon faces the reality of having a giant new room-mate in the form of Rob, the man whose child she happens to be carrying. She introduces him to her brother Fergal (Jonathan Forbes) who gives them both a royal hard time. Rob connects with an old school pal Dave (Daniel Lapaine), who's evolved into a delightful scumbag. Rob then endeavours to cook up a proper proposal to help Sharon feel better about the clumsiness of their situation. Writers: Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan; Prod: Jack Bayles;(n)

programme.title: David Beckham 7
programme.desc: A profile of the former United star.(n)

programme.title: United Ink
programme.desc: This documentary features fans from around the globe who have decided to demonstrate their enormous passion for the club through tattoos, plus some exclusive player interviews on the subject.(n)

programme.title: United v Liverpool 12/13
programme.desc: Action from the Premier League match at Old Trafford.(n)
